title._content: Bank of Chambersburg & Franklin House, Chambersburg, Franklin Co., Pa., destroyed by the rebels under McCausland, July 30th, 1864 (LOC)

description._content: Bank of Chambersburg & Franklin House, Chambersburg, Franklin Co., Pa., destroyed by the rebels under McCausland, July 30th, 1864 [1864] 1 photographic print on stereo card : albumen ; 3.25 x 6.75 in. Notes: Photo shows buildings burned by the Confederate cavalry troops of General John McCausland in Chambersburg, Pennsylvania, in reprisal for destruction by Union troops in the Shenandoah Valley. No. 507. Copyright by Charles E. Meyer, 1864. Title from item. Forms part of: Civil War Photograph Collection (Library of Congress). Published in: The Civil War in depth / Bob Zeller. San Francisco: Chronicle Books, 1997-2000, v. 1, p. 89. Subjects: War damage--Pennsylvania--Chambersburg--1860-1870. United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Destruction & Pillage. Format: Stereographs--1860-1870. Albumen prints--1860-1870. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/stereo.1s02529 hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/stereo.2s02529 Call Number: LOT 4164, no. 204
